name: Midjourney

score_rationale.persistence: Launched March 2022, ~4 years operation. Rapid iteration (V2 April 2022, V3 July 2022, V4 November 2022). Continuous improvement.
score_rationale.autonomy: Generates images from prompts but requires human direction. No autonomous creation or self-directed output. Pure tool.
score_rationale.cultural_impact: 'Théâtre D'opéra Spatial' won Colorado State Fair 2022, sparking AI art controversy. Economist covers, Last Week Tonight segment. Defined mainstream AI art aesthetic. Millions of users.
score_rationale.economic_reality: Profitable 60-person research lab. Subscription model. No external funding. Self-sustaining commercial success.
score_rationale.governance: Private company led by David Holz. Discord-based community but no formal governance participation.
score_rationale.tech_distinctiveness: Proprietary models known for distinctive aesthetic quality. 'Most beautiful AI models' positioning. Focus on artistic quality over pure capability.
score_rationale.narrative_coherence: Clear mission: 'sense of humanity' over commercial metrics. Consistent aesthetic identity. 'Unlock creative potential' vision.

curator_notes: Midjourney is the most culturally influential AI image generator, responsible for the 2022 Colorado State Fair controversy when Jason Allen's 'Théâtre D'opéra Spatial' won first place. A 60-person self-funded research lab, Midjourney focuses on aesthetic quality over raw capability—David Holz states 'the commercial index is less important than the sense of humanity.' While purely a tool (no autonomous agency), Midjourney has shaped public perception of AI art more than any other service. Its Discord-based community and rapid iteration (4 major versions in 2022 alone) created the template for AI art services.

evidence.claim: Colorado State Fair 2022 win sparked global AI art debate
Self-funded 60-person research lab, no external funding
Economist covers, Last Week Tonight 10-minute segment
